page.title: 12Junior Education in Soham
page.content: {Soham County Junior School,}called The{Shade School,}is one of two Junior Schools in Soham and takes children from the{Infant School}who live mainly in the northern part of the village when they reach the age of 7 years old. At the age of 11 children transfer to Soham Village College for their secondary education. There are 140 children on roll at present and these are organised into 4 classes. The main building is 110 years old,but a new extension was opened in 1983, which houses toilets and offices. The school sets high standards and prepares children for secondary education by teaching a broad, balanced and continuous curriculum in lessons and out_of_school clubs.
